Package states

Class Playing

java.lang.Object
states.State
states.Playing
All Implemented Interfaces:
StateMethods
public class Playing extends State implements StateMethods
This is a child class of State that implements the StateMethods interface. This class handles the core game loop of completing levels, it represents how a level will be played by the user.
Author:
johnbotonakis

  • Method Details

    • initClasses

      private void initClasses()
      Initializes the classes as a function instead of calling upon them individually Level Manager, Enemy Manager, and Player entity are all loaded here

    • nextLevel

      public void nextLevel(int nextLevelIndex)
      This function will load a specific level based on the index given into the parameters
      Parameters:
      nextLevelIndex - - the next level to be loaded in, index is the same as stage number

    • loadCurrentLevel

      private void loadCurrentLevel()
      Load in all of the enemies and other items in from the current Level. It will reset all booleans to get the Level ready to play for the user

    • initBackgroundAssets

      private void initBackgroundAssets()
      Initialize the assets that compose the background for the given level Will dynamically switch to another set of assets depending on the world

    • update

      public void update()
      Every tick, this function updates the game by invoking the similarly named update command on each entity either directly with player.update, or through a manager such as enemyManager.update This function also controls the screen scroller
      Specified by:
      update in interface StateMethods

    • screenScroller

    • windowFocusLost

      public void windowFocusLost()
      When window focus is lost for whatever reason, this resets the player input, to allow the player to pick up where they were before interruption.

    • addPlayerArrow

      public void addPlayerArrow(float x, float y, float slope, boolean left)
      create a new arrow at a specific point in the screen, along with the slope that the arrow will take
      Parameters:
      x - - the x coordinate of the new Arrow
      y - - the y coordinate of the new Arrow
      slope - - the slope/path that the arrow will take
      left - - true if the arrow is moving left, false is moving right
